results.title: Blokes and sheds - Bruno
results.creator_credit: Robi Watt, Sarah Wishart, Australian Film Commission, SBS Independent, South Australian Film Corporation and Mark Thomson
results.brief_description:
One of 12 minidocos about blokes and their sheds in South Australia.
Bruno has built a wooden oven in his shed. He fires the oven up early in the day, to bake the dough that he, his wife Guissepina, and his son Sam, have mixed up in a big wooden trough. By 9am the neighborhood smells of fresh bread as the beautiful rounded loaves are slid out of the oven on a long handled bread board before being eaten dipped in homemade olive oil and accompanied by other delicious flavors from the garden and of course, homemade wine. Based on the book by Mark Thomson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robi Watt, Sarah Wishart, Australian Film Commission, SBS Independent, South Australian Film Corporation and Mark Thomson

results.title: Blokes and sheds - Attilio
results.creator_credit: Robi Watt, Sarah Wishart, Australian Film Commission, SBS Independent, South Australian Film Corporation and Mark Thomson
results.brief_description:
Oe of 12 minidocos about blokes and their sheds in South Australia.
Attilio, a retired fitter and turner, is part of a powerful Italian tradition of high quality artisanship. He still works at home, doing small, specialised jobs. His basic galvanised iron shed is lined with tools of the trade - boxes and shelves filled with mostly metallic bits and pieces that get pieced together with absolute passion and craft. Attilio is also an entertainer - a funny guy and the life of the party. He has produced many CDs of his songs and is regularly booked for events by the South Australian Italian community. Attilio’s taverna is an open-sided room with a big table and a gas stove at one end - complete with an espresso machine for making short blacks (sometimes with a dash of the grappa!). In his taverna Attilio spends time with his brother Joe and his friends, enjoying Italian food and the fruits of his other labour – wine making. So Attilio’s backyard has two sheds – one for sharing friendship and entertainment, the other for the serious work. Based on the book by Mark Thomson.

results.title: My first alphabet
results.creator_credit: Debney Park Secondary College, Colin Read, Gene Geoffrey and Jenny Cocks
results.brief_description: A colourful and engaging animated alphabet with an Oz flavour to it suitable for young children between the ages 3 to 6. The claymation characters were created and designed by all the students from Year 8/9 Art and Design, Debney Park Secondary College.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Debney Park Secondary College, Colin Read, Gene Geoffrey and Jenny Cocks

results.title: Radio romance
results.brief_description: Radio romance is an endearing work which creates warmth through the subtle use of multiple narratives and the affable assured performance of the band. Camera work and editing confidently exploit the rich setting with the songline expertly supported by the light-hearted use of props. Music performed by Strange Country.

results.title: Derick and Jonathan
results.brief_description: Set in a school, this delightful piece makes very effective use of setting and the familiarity of its audience to the trials and tribulations of two unlikely heroes in their ever-hopeful and competitive quest for love. The well-developed script and voice-over establishes an affectionate, playful tone complemented by the scenarios in which the lead characters find themselves.

results.title: Just business
results.brief_description:
A drama of revenge and retribution demonstrating high production values to create a corporate world of greed and indifference. Controlled camera work, lighting and slick editing combine with assured direction of the actors to create tension as this disturbing tale reaches its climax.
WARNING: THIS FILM CONTAINS SCENES THAT MAY DISTURB SOME VIEWERS

results.title: Short black
results.brief_description: This tightly scripted work employs Chandleresque dialogue, noirish mise en scene and high key lighting to create a wisecracking, character driven crime story. Inanimate clay figures and controlled comic timing create characters in an absurdist style which draw viewers’ attention to the features of the genre.

results.title: Hunger nation
results.brief_description: This flash animation creates a dismal vision of the future. Effective use of repetition, perspective and scale creates the illusion of depth immersing the audience in an apocalyptic world. A skilfully restrained yet multilayered sound design combines with visual composition revealing confident use of the Flash program.

results.title: Urban scrawl
results.brief_description: This vibrant documentary leads its audience to a more sophisticated understanding of the controversial artistic subculture of street art. Well controlled production values allow the reasoned arguments of those involved to be developed in a manner that is both thought provoking and educative.

results.title: A Fist full of trolleys
results.brief_description: Set in a supermarket car park, this exquisitly framed black and white genre based work references a rich visual culture of photography and cinema. The fierce struggle between man and his environment has been transposed into a stark and familiar urban landscape.
